Getting Started¶

In this tutorial, you’ll learn the basics of simple_pack. This is mostly a way for me to learn.

[1]:

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from simple_pack import SIR_model

Using the SIR_Model¶

Let’s start by solving the SIR equations.

[2]:

sir = SIR_model()
solutions = sir.integrate()

[3]:

labels = ['Susceptible', 'Infected', 'Recovered']
colors = ['black', 'red', 'blue']

[4]:

plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
for i, j in enumerate(solutions.y):
    plt.plot(solutions.t, j, color = colors[i], label = labels[i])

plt.legend(fontsize = 18)
plt.xlabel('Days', fontsize = 18)
plt.ylabel('People', fontsize = 18)
plt.show()

[ ]:

xcorr
